data.name: AppDescription_HelpText
data.value: The manifest creation command line utility generates manifest for submitting apps to the Windows Package Manager repo.

data.name: AppMoniker_KeywordDescription
data.value: The most common package term

data.name: Arch_KeywordDescription
data.value: The installer target architecture

data.name: Author_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package author

data.name: BrowserFailedToLaunch_Error
data.value: Web browser failed to launch: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the exception thrown when the browser fails to launch

data.name: ChangeOutputDirToCurrDir_Message
data.value: Output directory changed to current directory: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the current directory path

data.name: Channel_KeywordDescription
data.value: The distribution channel

data.name: ClearToken_Message
data.value: Clearing GitHub token cache

data.name: Clear_HelpText
data.value: Clear the cached GitHub token

data.name: Commands_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of commands or aliases to run the package

data.name: ConfirmGitHubSubmitManifest_Message
data.value: Would you like to submit your manifest to the Windows Package Manager repository?

data.name: CopyrightUrl_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package copyright page

data.name: Copyright_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package copyright

data.name: Custom_KeywordDescription
data.value: The custom installer switches

data.name: DefaultLocale_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package meta-data default locale |e.g. en-US|

data.name: Description_KeywordDescription
data.value: The full package description

data.name: DirectoriesFound_Message
data.value: {0} directories found in {1}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the number of directories found in the cache folder {1} - Will be replaced with the path to the cache folder

data.name: DoneSymbol_String
data.value: DONE

data.name: DownloadFile_Error
data.value: Failed to download installer.

data.name: DownloadInstaller_Message
data.value: Downloading and parsing: {0}...
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the installer URL

data.name: EnterFollowingFields_Message
data.value: Please enter values for the following fields:

data.name: EnterUserCode_Message
data.value: Please enter the following user verification code when prompted: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the user verification code that must be entered in the GitHub OAuth webpage

data.name: Error_Prefix
data.value: ERROR: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced by the thrown exception message

data.name: Example_NewCommand_DownloadInstaller
data.value: Download installer and extract metadata
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the New Command that launches the manifest creation process with the user providing an installer URL to be downloaded and extracted.

data.name: Example_NewCommand_SaveLocallyOrSubmit
data.value: Save locally and submit a pull request
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the New Command that allows the user to decide where to save the newly-generated manifest locally and whether to submit directly to GitHub for a pull request.

data.name: Example_NewCommand_StartFromScratch
data.value: Start from scratch
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the New Command that launches the manifest creation process without any arguments.

data.name: Example_SubmitCommand_SubmitLocalManifest
data.value: Submit local manifest file to Windows Package Manager repo

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_SaveAndPublish
data.value: Save and publish updated manifest

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_SearchAndUpdateVersionAndInstallerURL
data.value: Search for an existing manifest and update the installer url and version
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the Update Command that pulls down a manifest by ID and updates the installer URL field and version field with the values provided by the user.

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_SubmitToGitHub
data.value: Update an existing manifest and submit PR to GitHub
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the Update Command that updates an existing manifest and submits a pull request to GitHub.

data.name: FileExtensions_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of file extensions the package could support

data.name: PathDoesNotExist_Warning
data.value: Path does not exist

data.name: Path_HelpText
data.value: Path to a manifest file or directory containing the manifests that you want to submit to the Windows Package Manager repo

data.name: GitHubFailedAuthorization_Message
data.value: GitHub authorization failed: {0} - {1}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with error code {1} - will be replaced with error description

data.name: GitHubLoginFail_Error
data.value: GitHub login failed.

data.name: GitHubToken_HelpText
data.value: GitHub personal access token used for direct submission to the Windows Package Manager repo. If no token is provided, tool will prompt for GitHub login credentials.

data.name: Heading
data.value: Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator v{0}
data.comment: {0} will be replaced with program's semantic version number

data.name: Homepage_KeywordDescription
data.value: The home page for the package

data.name: PackageIdentifier_HelpText
data.value: Package identifier used to lookup the existing manifest on the Windows Package Manager repo. Id is case-sensitive.

data.name: PackageIdentifier_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package unique identifier |e.g. Microsoft.VisualStudio|

data.name: InstallerArchitecture_KeywordDescription
data.value: The installer target architecture

data.value: The SHA256 installer hash

data.value: The installer location redirection path

data.value: Overrides default language

data.value: The installer minimum operating system version

data.value: Privacy statement: {0}

data.value: HTTP response was unsuccessful. Status code: {0}

data.value: Invalid URL provided. Please check the URL and try again.

data.value: Failed to parse the package from [{0}]
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the failed installer url

data.name: PackageIdAlreadyExists_Error
data.value: We have detected that this package identifier already exists. If you intend to update an existing package, please use the update command.

data.name: SettingsCommand_HelpText
data.value: Open settings

data.name: ErrorParsingSettingsFile_Message
data.value: Error parsing file: {0}.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the path to the settings file.

data.name: GenerateNewSettingsFile_Message
data.value: No settings file found, generating new settings file from loaded settings...

data.name: LoadSettingsFromBackup_Message
data.value: Loaded settings from backup file.

data.name: LoadSettingsFromDefault_Message
data.value: Loaded settings from default factory settings.

data.name: TelemetryAnonymous_Message
data.value: The data is anonymous and collected only by Microsoft.

data.name: TelemetryJustification_Message
data.value: The Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator collects usage data in order to improve your experience.

data.name: TelemetrySettings_Message
data.value: Telemetry Settings

data.name: UnexpectedErrorLoadSettings_Message
data.value: Unexpected error while loading settings. Please verify your settings by running the settings command.

data.name: CompareUpdatedManifestWithExisting_Message
data.value: Please ensure that the updated manifest you are submitting is different from the existing package.

data.name: InvalidTokenError_Message
data.value: Invalid token provided, please generate a new GitHub token and try again.

data.name: NoChangeDetectedInUpdatedManifest_Message
data.value: Submitting a manifest without any updated changes is not allowed.

data.name: InstallerMatchFailedError_Message
data.value: The following installers failed to match an existing installer node:

data.name: UnboundArguments_Message
data.value: The following unbound argument(s) were detected: "{0}"
data.comment: {0} - The additional unbound arguments present in the command line arguments.

data.name: VerifyCommandUsage_Message
data.value: Please check and verify the usage of this command by passing in the --help flag.

data.name: ModifyOptionalDefaultLocaleFields_Message
data.value: Would you like to modify the optional default locale fields?

data.name: NewInstallerUrlMustMatchExisting_Message
data.value: Each new installer URL must have a single match to an existing installer based on architecture, installer type and scope. The following installers failed to match an existing installer:

data.name: DetectedArchMismatch_Message
data.value: The architecture detected from the binary might be different than what is specified in the installer URL for the following installer(s):

data.name: InstallerBinaryMismatch_Message
data.value: Using architecture detected from URL ({0}), overriding architecture detected from binary ({1})
data.comment: {0} - Architecture detected from the installer URL {1} - Architecture determined from the installer binary

data.name: RepositoryNotFound_Error
data.value: Repository "{0}/{1}" not found. Please verify the Windows Package Manager repository owner and name in your settings file.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the owner name of the Windows Package Manager repository {1} - will be replaced with the name of the Windows Package Manager repository

data.name: CacheCommand_HelpText
data.value: Manage downloaded installers stored in cache

data.name: Clean_HelpText
data.value: Deletes all downloaded installers in the cache folder

data.name: List_HelpText
data.value: Lists out all the downloaded installers stored in cache

data.name: Open_HelpText
data.value: Opens the cache folder storing the downloaded installers

data.name: InstallersFound_Message
data.value: {0} installers found in {1}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the number of installers found in the cache folder {1} - Will be replaced with the path to the downloaded installer cache folder

data.name: DeletingItem_Message
data.value: Deleting {0}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the name of the item to be deleted.

data.name: InstallerCacheCleaned_Message
data.value: Installer cache cleaned.

data.name: DeletingInvalidCachedToken_Message
data.value: Cached token was invalid, deleting token from cache...

data.name: InvalidGitHubToken_Message
data.value: Token was invalid. Please generate a new GitHub token and try again.

data.name: RateLimitExceeded_Message
data.value: GitHub api rate limit exceeded. To extend your rate limit, provide your GitHub token with the '-t' flag or store one using the 'token --store' command.
data.comment: '-t' refers to a command line switch argument 'token --store' refers to a command line argument

data.name: SettingToken_Message
data.value: Setting GitHub token...

data.name: StoringToken_Message
data.value: Token stored in cache successfully.

data.name: GetLatestVersion_Message
data.value: For the latest version ({0}), go to {1}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the latest release version {1} - Will be replaced with the URL to the latest version of the tool.

data.name: OutdatedVersionNotice_Message
data.value: This is an older version of Winget-Create and may be missing some critical features.

data.name: UpgradeUsingWinget_Message
data.value: If you have the winget client installed, you can update by running the command: `winget upgrade Microsoft.WingetCreate`
data.comment:
`winget upgrade Microsoft.WingetCreate` refers to a specific command to be executed in order to upgrade the tool to the latest version.
"winget" is the proper name of the tool

data.name: TelemetryEnabledByDefault_Message
data.value: By default, telemetry is enabled but can be disabled by running `wingetcreate settings` and editing your settings file.
data.comment: `wingetcreate settings` refers to a specific command to be executed if the user wants to modify their settings.

data.name: DownloadFileExceedsMaxSize_Error
data.value: URL points to file larger than the maximum size of {0}MB
data.comment: {0} - represents the maximum size of a downloaded file

data.name: InstallerCountMustMatch_Error
data.value: The number of new installer packages must match the number of existing installer packages.

data.name: MultipleMatchedInstaller_Error
data.value: Multiple matches found for {0} {1} installer detected from the url: {2}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with installer architecture {1} - will be replaced with the installer type {2} - will be replaced with the installer

data.name: UnmatchedInstaller_Error
data.value: No matches found for {0} {1} installer detected from url: {2}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with installer architecture {1} - will be replaced with the installer type {2} - will be replaced with the installer

data.name: AdditionalMetadataNeeded_Message
data.value: Additional metadata needed for installer from {0}
data.comment: {0} - Installer URL of the installer

data.value: ADD

data.value: ALL INSTALLERS

data.value: BACK

data.value: Displaying a preview of the selected installer:

data.value: DISPLAY PREVIEW

data.value: DONE

data.value: [{0}] value is

data.value: Filter menu items by typing a search query below.

data.value: Would you like to modify the optional installer fields?

data.value: What would you like to do?

data.value: Which property would you like to edit?

data.name: InteractiveUpdate_HelpText
data.value: Boolean value for making the update command interactive. If true, the tool will prompt the user for input. Default is false.

data.name: InstallerUpdatedSuccessfully_Message
data.value: Installer updated successfully!

data.name: NewInstallerUrl_Message
data.value: What is the new installer url?

data.name: PressKeyToContinue_Message
data.value: Press any key to continue...

data.name: UpdatingInstallerOutOfTotal_Message
data.value: Updating {0} of {1} installers:
data.comment: {0} - represents the current installer index that is being updated {1} - represents the total number of installers to be updated

data.name: DiscardUpdateAndStartOver_Message
data.value: Would you like to discard this update and start over?

data.name: ResolveMatchingConflicts_Message
data.value: To resolve matching conflicts manually, use the --interactive flag.
data.comment: `--interactive` - refers to a flag that can be included with the command

data.name: DefenderVirus_ErrorMessage
data.value: Operation did not complete successfully because the downloaded file contains a virus or potentially unwanted software. For more information on potentially unwanted software and what options are available, see https://aka.ms/winget-create-security

data.name: InstallerSelection_MenuItem
data.value: INSTALLER {0}: {1}
data.comment: {0} - represents the installer index number {1} - represents the associated installer metadata

data.name: EditManifests_Message
data.value: Would you like to edit your manifests?

data.name: SaveAndExit_MenuItem
data.value: SAVE AND EXIT

data.name: SelectManifestToEdit_Message
data.value: Which manifest do you want to edit?

data.name: DownloadConnectionTimeout_Error
data.value: Unable to complete the download request as the connection has timed out. Please verify your installer URL and try again.

data.name: ArchitectureOverride_Warning
data.value: If the installer you provided fails to match an existing installer even when overriding the architecture, you may need to override the scope or edit the existing manifest manually. Make sure that the existing manifest has a single installer that matches the overriding architecture, scope and installer type of the new installer. To modify an existing manifest, use the '--interactive' flag with the update command and submit the new changes. Once the changes are published, please try again.
data.comment: '--interactive' refers to a flag that can be included with the command-line arguments for this tool.

data.name: MultipleArchitectureOverride_Error
data.value: Multiple architectures detected. Only one architecture can be specified for an override.

data.name: UnableToParseArgument_Error
data.value: Unable to parse the specified argument {0}.
data.comment: {0} - represents the url argument that failed to parse.

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_OverrideArchitecture
data.value: Override the architecture of an installer

data.name: OverridingArchitecture_Warning
data.value: Overriding {0} with architecture {1}
data.comment: {0} - represents the InstallerUrl {1} - represents the overriding architecture

data.name: AgreementLabel_KeywordDescription

data.name: UpgradeCode_KeywordDescription

data.comment: "winget" is the proper name of the tool

data.name: ConfirmPortablePackage_Message
data.value: Is this a portable package?

data.name: PortableCommandAlias_Message
data.value: What is the command alias of the portable package |e.g. nuget|
data.comment: `command alias` refers to the name of the exe file that will be used when running the application from the command line.

data.name: SyncForkWithUpstream_Message
data.value: Unable to create a reference to the forked repository. This can be caused when the forked repository is behind by too many commits. Sync your fork and try again.

data.name: DefaultInstallLocation_KeywordDescription
data.value: Represents the default installed package location. Used for deeper installation detection

data.name: FileSha256_KeywordDescription
data.value: The optional Sha256 of the installed file

data.name: Files_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of installed files

data.name: FileType_KeywordDescription
data.value: The optional installed file type

data.name: InstallationMetadata_KeywordDescription
data.value: Details about the installation. Used for deeper installation detection

data.name: InvalidZipFile_ErrorMessage
data.value: The package file is not a valid zip archive.

data.name: InvocationParameter_KeywordDescription
data.value: The optional parameter for invocable files

data.name: NestedInstallerParsing_HelpText
data.value: Parsing nested installer '{0}' from {1}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with RelativeFilePath of the nested installer {1} - will be replaced by the InstallerUrl

data.name: NestedInstallerFileNotFound_Error
data.value: Nested installer not found in zip archive: {0}. Please use the interactive mode to update this package.
data.comment: {0} - represents the relative file path of the nested installer file.

data.name: NestedInstallerFiles_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of nested installer files contained inside an archive

data.name: NestedInstallerType_KeywordDescription
data.value: The nested installer type contained inside an archive

data.name: NoInstallersFoundInArchive_ErrorMessage
data.value: No supported installer(s) found in zip archive.

data.name: PortableCommandAlias_KeywordDescription
data.value: The command alias to be used for calling the nested portable package

data.name: RelativeFilePath_KeywordDescription
data.value: The relative file path to the nested installer file

data.name: SelectInstallersFromZip_Message
data.value: Select the installer(s) from the zip archive:

data.name: MultipleNestedArchitectures_Message
data.value: Multiple nested installer architectures were detected for following archive packages:

data.name: ZipPathExceedsMaxLength_ErrorMessage
data.value: The downloaded zip contains path exceeding the system-defined maximum length.

data.name: NetworkConnectionFailure_Message
data.value: Failed to connect to GitHub. Check your network connection.

data.name: MultipleScopeOverride_Error
data.value: Multiple scopes detected. Only one scope can be specified for an override.

data.name: ArgumentLimitExceeded_Error
data.value: Too many arguments specified for the following installer URL: {0}
data.comment: {0} - represents the installer URL argument that the user is providing. The installer URL can be modified by appending '|scope|architecture' to override the detected values for that particular installer.

data.name: OverridingScope_Warning
data.value: Overriding {0} with scope {1}
data.comment: {0} - represents the InstallerUrl {1} - represents the overriding scope

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_OverrideScope
data.value: Override the scope of an installer

data.name: UnmatchedNestedInstaller_Error
data.value: No matches found for "{0}" from {1}

data.name: IconFileType_KeywordDescription
data.value: The icon file type

data.name: IconResolution_KeywordDescription
data.value: The icon resolution

data.name: IconSha256_KeywordDescription
data.value: The SHA256 hash of the icon file

data.name: Icons_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of icons

data.name: IconTheme_KeywordDescription
data.value: The icon theme

data.name: IconUrl_KeywordDescription
data.value: The url of the hosted icon file

data.name: MultipleMatchingNestedInstallersFound_Error
data.value: Multiple matches found for "{0}" from {1}. Please use the interactive mode to update this package.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced by the name of the nested installer file {1} - will be replaced by the name of the zip archive.

data.name: MultipleMatchingNestedInstallersFound_Warning
data.value: Multiple matches found for "{0}" from {1}.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced by the name of the nested installer file {1} - will be replaced by the name of the zip archive.

data.name: NestedInstallerFileNotFound_Warning
data.value: Nested installer not found in zip archive: {0}
data.comment: {0} - represents the relative file path of the nested installer file.

data.name: NestedInstallerTypeNotFound_Error
data.value: The zip archive does not contain a matching installer type with the old relative path.

data.name: SelectRelativeFilePath_Message
data.value: Select the new relative file path

data.value: Display a manifest from the Windows Package Manager repository

data.comment: {0} - will be replaced by the PackageLocale from the manifest

data.value: Show the manifests of a specified version of the package

data.value: Show only the installer and default locale manifests

data.value: Singleton Manifest:

data.name: VersionManifest_HelpText
data.value: Display the version manifest of the package.

data.value: Version Manifest:

data.name: ReplacePrevious_HelpText
data.value: Boolean value for replacing an existing manifest from the Windows Package Manager repo. Optionally provide a version or else the latest version will be replaced. Default is false.

data.name: VersionDoesNotExist_Error
data.value: Version {0} does not exist for {1} in the Windows Package Manager repository.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the package version {1} - will be replaced with the package ID

data.name: ReplaceVersion_HelpText
data.value: Optional. Package version used in conjunction with the replace argument to replace an older version of the manifest from the Windows Package Manager repo.

data.name: ReplaceVersionEqualsUpdateVersion_ErrorMessage
data.value: The replace version cannot be equal to the update version.

data.name: UseOverrides_ErrorMessage
data.value: Try using the architecture and/or scope overrides to uniquely match new URLs to existing installer nodes in the manifest.

data.name: AutoReplacingPreviousVersion_Message
data.value: Vanity URL detected. The submission will automatically replace the previous version.

data.name: SentenceBadFormatConversionErrorOption
data.value: Option '{0}' is defined with a bad format.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the provided command-line option

data.name: SentenceBadFormatConversionErrorValue
data.value: A value not bound to option name is defined with a bad format.

data.name: SentenceBadFormatTokenError
data.value: Token '{0}' is not recognized.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the unrecognized command-line token

data.name: SentenceBadVerbSelectedError
data.value: Verb '{0}' is not recognized.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the unrecognized command-line verb

data.name: SentenceErrorsHeadingText
data.value: ERROR(S):

data.name: SentenceHelpCommandTextOption
data.value: Display this help screen.

data.name: SentenceHelpCommandTextVerb
data.value: Display more information on a specific command.

data.name: SentenceMissingRequiredOptionError
data.value: Required option '{0}' is missing.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the required command-line option

data.name: SentenceMissingValueOptionError
data.value: Option '{0}' has no value.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the provided command-line option

data.name: SentenceMutuallyExclusiveSetErrors
data.value: Options: {0} are not compatible with {1}.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with one or more provided command-line option(s) {1} - will be replaced with one or more provided command-line option(s)

data.name: SentenceNoVerbSelectedError
data.value: No verb selected.

data.name: SentenceOptionGroupWord
data.value: Group

data.name: SentenceRepeatedOptionError
data.value: Option '{0}' is defined multiple times.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the repeated command-line option

data.name: SentenceRequiredWord
data.value: Required.

data.name: SentenceSequenceOutOfRangeErrorOption
data.value: A sequence option '{0}' is defined with fewer or more items than required.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the provided command-line option

data.name: SentenceSequenceOutOfRangeErrorValue
data.value: A sequence value not bound to option name is defined with fewer items than required.

data.name: SentenceSetValueExceptionError
data.value: Error setting value to option '{0}': {1}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the provided command-line option {1} - will be replaced with the provided value for the command-line option

data.name: SentenceUnknownOptionError
data.value: Option '{0}' is unknown.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the unrecognized command-line option

data.name: SentenceUsageHeadingText
data.value: USAGE:

data.value: Display version information.

data.name: SentenceMissingRequiredValueError
data.value: A required value not bound to option name is missing.

data.value: Would you like to create another locale?

data.value: Default locale

data.name: Example_NewLocaleCommand_AddForLatestVersion
data.value: Add a new locale for the latest version of a package

data.name: Example_NewLocaleCommand_AddForSpecificVersion
data.value: Add a new locale for a specific version of a package

data.name: Example_NewLocaleCommand_SaveToDirectory
data.value: Create a new locale and save the generated manifests to a specified directory

data.name: Example_UpdateLocaleCommand_SaveToDirectory
data.value: Update existing locale and save the generated manifests to a specified directory

data.value: Update existing locale for a specific version of a package

data.value: Generating a preview of the updated locale(s)....

data.name: InvalidLocale_ErrorMessage
data.value: Invalid locale. Enter a valid language tag.

data.name: LocaleAlreadyExists_ErrorMessage
data.value: Locale manifest matching with input locale "{0}" already exists. Use the update-locale command to update an existing locale manifest.
data.comment: {0} - represents the input package locale string

data.name: NewLocaleCommand_Version_HelpText
data.value: The version of the package to add a new locale for.

data.name: SelectExistingLocale_Message
data.value: Select an existing locale

data.name: UpdateAdditionalLocaleProperties_Message
data.value: Would you like to modify additional locale properties?

data.name: UpdateAnotherLocale_Message
data.value: Would you like to update another locale?

data.name: UpdateLocaleCommand_Version_HelpText
data.value: The version of the package to update the locale for.

data.name: NewLocaleCommand_HelpText
data.value: Launches a series of questions to help generate a new locale manifest

data.name: ReferenceLocale_HelpText
data.value: Existing locale manifest to be used as reference for default values. If not provided, the default locale manifest will be used.

data.name: UpdateLocaleCommand_HelpText
data.value: Launches a series of questions to help update an existing locale manifest

data.name: ReferenceLocaleNotFound_Error
data.value: The reference locale does not exist in the manifest.

data.name: FieldSetToValue_Message
data.value: [{0}] value is: {1}
data.comment: {0} - represents the name of the manifest field {1} - represents the value of the manifest field

data.name: UpdateLocaleCommand_Locale_HelpText
data.value: The package locale to update the manifest for. If not provided, the tool will prompt you a list of existing locales to choose from.

data.name: NewLocaleCommand_Locale_HelpText
data.value: The package locale to create a new manifest for. If not provided, the tool will prompt for this value.

data.name: LocaleDoesNotExist_Message
data.value: Manifest for input locale "{0}" does not exist. Use the new-locale command to generate a new locale manifest.
data.comment: {0} - represents the package locale string

data.name: SwitchToNewLocaleFlow_Message
data.value: Would you like to create the locale manifest instead?

data.name: SwitchToUpdateLocaleFlow_Message
data.value: Would you like to update the locale manifest instead?

data.name: DownloadCommandProhibited_KeywordDescription
data.value: Indicates whether the installer is prohibited from being downloaded for offline installation

data.name: NewLocaleCommand_Header
data.value: This command will walk you through a series of questions to help generate a new locale manifest.

data.name: NewLocaleCommand_PrePrompt_Header
data.value: Press ENTER to submit the value for each question including accepting the (reference) value from reference locale manifest.

data.name: SubmitFlagMissing_Warning
data.value: Submit arguments were provided. Did you forget to include the --submit, -s flag?
data.comment: '--submit, -s' refers to a command line switch argument

data.name: ReplacePackageIdDoesNotExist_Error
data.value: Replace operation cannot be performed. Package identifier '{0}' does not exist in the Windows Package Manager repo.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the ID of the package

data.name: ReplaceVersionEqualsSubmitVersion_ErrorMessage
data.value: The replace version cannot be equal to the submit version.

data.name: InvalidManifestFormat_ErrorMessage
data.value: The provided manifest format is invalid.

data.name: ManifestFormat_HelpText
data.value: Output format of the manifest. Default is "yaml".

data.name: FormatNotSupportedForDefaultRepo_Error
data.value: Format not supported. The Windows Package Manager Community repository accepts only "yaml" manifest submissions.

data.name: Example_TokenCommand_ClearExistingToken
data.value: Clear the cached GitHub token

data.name: Example_TokenCommand_StoreNewToken
data.value: Store a new GitHub token in your local cache

data.name: UnchangedDisplayVersion_Warning
data.value: Base manifest contains DisplayVersion that has not been updated. Use --display-version CLI arg or provide the version in the installer URL.

data.name: DisplayVersion_HelpText
data.value: Version to be used when updating the display version field. Version provided in the installer URL arguments will take precedence over this value.

data.name: UsingDisplayVersion_Message
data.value: Using display version '{0}' for {1}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the display version provided in the installer URL {1} - will be replaced by the installer URL

data.name: InstallerWithMultipleDisplayVersions_Warning
data.value: Single installer with multiple display versions detected. Winget-Create will only update the first DisplayVersion for a given installer.

data.name: CouldNotPopulateGitHubMetadata_Warning
data.value: Could not populate manifest metadata through GitHub's API.

data.name: PopulatedGitHubMetadata_Message
data.value: GitHub URL detected. The CLI has automatically filled some manifests fields.

data.name: ReleaseDate_HelpText
data.value: Date to be used when updating the release date field. Expected format is "YYYY-MM-DD".

data.name: ReleaseNotesUrl_HelpText
data.value: URL to be used when updating the release notes url field.
